body_html:
Probably even more than upgrade, you have to uninstall first otherwise pip
may not install anything find you have 3.0.0 already.
On Thu, Sep 29, 2016 at 01:23 Jonathan Hseu notifications@github.com
wrote:

@jhseu commented on this pull request.

In tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md
#4642 (review)
:

+If your system/configuration is not listed above, you can use the following
+instructions to build your own protobuf wheel file.
+To install its prerequisites, see
+here:
+
+Then:
+```bash
+$ git clone https://github.com/google/protobuf.git

+$ cd protobuf
+$ ./autogen.sh
+$ CXXFLAGS="-fPIC -g -O2" ./configure
+$ make -j12
+$ export PROTOC=$PWD/src/protoc
+$ cd python
+$ python setup.py bdist_wheel --cpp_implementation --compile_static_extension
+$ pip install dist/

pip3 install --upgrade ?

—
You are receiving this because you were assigned.

or mute the thread

body_text:
Probably even more than upgrade, you have to uninstall first otherwise pip
may not install anything find you have 3.0.0 already.
On Thu, Sep 29, 2016 at 01:23 Jonathan Hseu notifications@github.com
wrote:

@jhseu commented on this pull request.
In tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md
#4642 (review)
:

+If your system/configuration is not listed above, you can use the following
+instructions to build your own protobuf wheel file.
+To install its prerequisites, see
+here:
+
+Then:
+```bash
+$ git clone https://github.com/google/protobuf.git

+$ cd protobuf
+$ ./autogen.sh
+$ CXXFLAGS="-fPIC -g -O2" ./configure
+$ make -j12
+$ export PROTOC=$PWD/src/protoc
+$ cd python
+$ python setup.py bdist_wheel --cpp_implementation --compile_static_extension
+$ pip install dist/
pip3 install --upgrade ?

body:
Probably even more than upgrade, you have to uninstall first otherwise pip
may not install anything find you have 3.0.0 already.
On Thu, Sep 29, 2016 at 01:23 Jonathan Hseu notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ## _@jhseu_ commented on this pull request.
> 
> In tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/4642#pullrequestreview-2073555
> :
> 
> > +If your system/configuration is not listed above, you can use the following
> > +instructions to build your own protobuf wheel file.
> > +To install its prerequisites, [see
> > +here](https://github.com/google/protobuf/blob/master/src/README.md):
> > +
> > +Then:
> > +```bash
> > +$ git clone https://github.com/google/protobuf.git
> 
> +$ cd protobuf
> +$ ./autogen.sh
> +$ CXXFLAGS="-fPIC -g -O2" ./configure
> +$ make -j12
> +$ export PROTOC=$PWD/src/protoc
> +$ cd python
> +$ python setup.py bdist_wheel --cpp_implementation --compile_static_extension
> +$ pip install dist/<wheel file name>
> 
> pip3 install --upgrade ?
> 
> —
